reactor.core.dispatch

Class AbstractLifecycleDispatcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • reactor.core.dispatch.AbstractLifecycleDispatcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Executor, Dispatcher, Resource
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MultiThreadDispatcher, SingleThreadDispatcher

    public abstract class AbstractLifecycleDispatcher
extends Object
implements Dispatcher
    A Dispatcher that has a lifecycle.
    Author:
    Jon Brisbin, Stephane Maldini

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this active Resource such that it can no longer be used. If the resource carries any work, it will wait for all the remaining tasks to perform before closing the resource.
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface Resource

      • forceShutdown

        public void forceShutdown()
        Description copied from interface: Resource
        Shutdown this Resource, forcibly halting any work currently executing and discarding any tasks that have not yet been executed.
        Specified by:
        forceShutdown in interface Resource

      • tryDispatch

        public final <E> void tryDispatch(E event,
                                  Consumer<E> eventConsumer,
                                  Consumer<Throwable> errorConsumer)
                           throws InsufficientCapacityException
        Description copied from interface: Dispatcher
        Instruct the Dispatcher to dispatch the data. If the dispatcher doesn't have enough capacity and might block on the next produced event, The event Consumer will receive the event. In the event of an error during dispatching, the errorConsumer will be called.
        Specified by:
        tryDispatch in interface Dispatcher
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of the event
        Parameters:
        event - The event
        eventConsumer - The consumer that is driven if dispatch succeeds
        errorConsumer - The consumer that is invoked if dispatch fails. May be null
        Throws:
        InsufficientCapacityException

      • dispatch

        public final <E> void dispatch(E event,
                               Consumer<E> eventConsumer,
                               Consumer<Throwable> errorConsumer)
        Description copied from interface: Dispatcher
        Instruct the Dispatcher to dispatch the data. The event Consumer will receive the event. In the event of an error during dispatching, the errorConsumer will be called.
        Specified by:
        dispatch in interface Dispatcher
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of the event
        Parameters:
        event - The event
        eventConsumer - The consumer that is driven if dispatch succeeds
        errorConsumer - The consumer that is invoked if dispatch fails. May be null
